description.value: As a ranged attack, an olghuth can heave a gob of caustic mucous with a range increment of 30 feet and the sicken critical hit effect.
The creature has the aquatic subtype, but it can breathe air and survive on land.
The creature can breathe water. It can’t breathe air unless it has the amphibious special ability (see page 152).

As a standard action, an olghuth can scream in anguish. Each creature within 30 feet of the olghuth takes 11d6 sonic damage and is shaken for 1d4 rounds. A creature that succeeds at a DC 17 Will save takes half damage and reduces the shaken condition to 1 round. An olghuth can use this ability every [[/r 1d6]]{1d6} rounds.

As a full action, an olghuth can move up to double its speed. Each creature and vehicle the olghuth is adjacent to at any point during its movement takes 2d6+10 slashing damage from the olghuth’s razor sharp fins and spines. A creature that succeeds at a DC 17 Reflex save takes half damage.

After eating a creature with an Intelligence of 6 or higher who died within the last 24 hours, an olghuth gains the ability to speak Aklo for a number of minutes equal to the CR of the consumed creature. During this time, the olghuth becomes euphoric and can’t use agonized wail.

biography.value:
Olghuths are amphibious ambush predators that stalk Aucturn’s Undulating Sea. Similar in appearance to a bulbous fish with squat, salamander-like legs and razor-sharp spined fins, olghuths have dozens of eyestalks that line their backs and dense beards of electrified tendrils that can cause temporary paralysis. Olghuths are consumed by constant pain, making them insatiably ravenous. They prefer to eat sapient creatures, and they frequently hunt along coasts, shallows, and ocean trade routes, where they capsize or sink water vehicles.

While many believe olghuths’ hunger causes their pain, centuries‑old rumors claim olghuths were once another creature entirely, or perhaps numerous creatures, who mutated into a monstrous amalgam due to Aucturn’s strange energies, which suggests their pain might be due to incompatible biology or mental anguish. Regardless, eating is the only balm for their wounds—after consuming a sapient creature, olghuths become temporarily euphoric and capable of speech. The cryptic, nonsensical ramblings of articulate olghuths are incredibly difficult to parse, but supposedly contain clues to the secrets of existence.
